title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
steps: 1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
2. In a pan, cook pancetta with garlic in olive oil until crispy.
3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
4. Drain spaghetti and add it to the pan with pancetta.
5. Remove pan from heat and mix in the egg mixture, stirring quickly to avoid scrambling.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
steps: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and tikka masala powder for at least 1 hour.
2. Grill or cook chicken until fully cooked, then set aside.
3. In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until soft.
4. Add tomatoes and cook until the mixture thickens.
5. Stir in cream and add the cooked chicken.
6. Simmer for 10 minutes, then garnish with cilantro and serve.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: A Russian-inspired dish with tender beef strips and a creamy sauce.
steps: 1. Heat oil in a pan and cook beef strips until browned.
2. Remove beef and set aside.
3. In the same pan, sauté onions, garlic, and mushrooms until soft.
4. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.
5. Add beef broth and mustard, stirring until thickened.
6. Return beef to the pan and stir in sour cream.
7. Simmer for 5 minutes, then season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice or noodles.

title: Pad Thai
summary: A popular Thai stir-fried noodle dish with shrimp, peanuts, and a tangy sauce.
ingredients: Cilantro and lime wedges for garnish
steps: 1. Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft, then drain.
2. Heat oil in a pan and cook shrimp until pink. Remove and set aside.
3. In the same pan, sauté garlic and add the egg, scrambling until cooked.
4. Add noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Stir in shrimp, bean sprouts, and green onions.
6. Serve topped with peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

title: Moussaka
summary: A Greek casserole layered with eggplant, ground meat, and béchamel sauce.
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Salt eggplant slices and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
3. Fry eggplant slices in olive oil until golden. Set aside.
4. In a pan, cook ground meat with onions, garlic, and spices until browned.
5. Add tomatoes and wine, simmering for 15 minutes.
6. In a saucepan, make béchamel sauce by melting butter, adding flour, and gradually whisking in milk until smooth. Stir in eggs and cheese.
7. Layer eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel in a baking dish.
8. Bake for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly.

title: Sushi Rolls
summary: Japanese rice rolls filled with seafood, vegetables, and sometimes tropical fruit.
steps: 1. Cook sushi rice according to package instructions.
2. Mix rice vinegar and sugar into the cooked rice and let cool.
3. Place a nori sheet on a bamboo mat and spread a thin layer of rice over it, leaving an edge.
4. Arrange cucumber, avocado, and fish in a line across the rice.
5. Roll tightly using the mat, then slice into pieces.
6. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

title: Tacos al Pastor
summary: Mexican street food with marinated pork, pineapple, and cilantro wrapped in a soft tortilla.
steps: 1. Marinate pork in pineapple juice, adobo sauce, chili powder, paprika, cumin, and garlic for at least 2 hours.
2. Grill or cook pork until tender and slightly charred.
3. Grill pineapple slices until caramelized.
4. Slice pork and pineapple, and serve in tortillas with cilantro and lime.

title: Vegetarian Lasagna
summary: A hearty, meat-free lasagna layered with spinach, mushrooms, and ricotta cheese.
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions.
3. In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and mushrooms in olive oil until soft.
4. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
5. In a baking dish, layer noodles, vegetable mixture, ricotta cheese, marinara sauce, and mozzarella.
6. Repeat layers and top with Parmesan cheese.
7. Bake for 30 minutes until bubbly and golden.

title: Ceviche
summary: A South American seafood dish made from fresh fish marinated in citrus juices.
steps: 1. Marinate fish in lime and lemon juice for 1-2 hours until opaque.
2. Mix in red onion, tomato, cucumber, avocado, and jalapeño.
3. Season with salt, pepper, and cilantro.
4. Serve chilled with tortilla chips or tostadas.

title: Butter Chicken
summary: A rich and creamy curry made with tender chicken pieces and aromatic spices.
steps: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and lemon juice for at least 1 hour.
2. In a pan, melt butter and cook onions, garlic, and ginger until soft.
3. Add tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, and cumin. Cook for 5 minutes.
4. Add chicken and cook until fully cooked.
5. Stir in cream and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Fettuccine Alfredo
summary: Italian pasta tossed with a creamy parmesan cheese sauce.
steps: 1. Cook fettuccine according to package instructions.
2. In a pan, melt butter and cook garlic until fragrant.
3. Add heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
4. Stir in Parmesan cheese until melted.
5. Toss pasta with the sauce and season with salt and pepper.
6. Garnish with parsley and serve.

title: Ratatouille
summary: A French Provençal stewed vegetable dish made with eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes.
steps: 1. Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onions and garlic until soft.
2. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper. Cook until tender.
3. Stir in tomatoes and thyme, and simmer for 20 minutes.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

title: Chicken Parmesan
summary: Breaded chicken cutlets covered with marinara sauce and melted cheese.
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Bread chicken breasts by coating in flour, dipping in beaten eggs, and then breadcrumbs.
3. Fry chicken in oil until golden and cooked through.
4. Place chicken in a baking dish, top with marinara sauce and cheeses.
5. Bake for 20 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Goulash
summary: A Hungarian stew of meat and vegetables, seasoned with paprika and other spices.
steps: 1. Heat oil in a pot and cook beef until browned.
2. Add onions and garlic and sauté until soft.
3. Stir in paprika, caraway seeds, bell pepper, and tomatoes.
4. Add beef broth and potatoes, and simmer for 1 hour.
5. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Peking Duck
summary: A famous Chinese dish featuring roasted duck with crispy skin and tender meat.
ingredients: Pancakes or steamed buns for serving
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
2. Rub duck with five-spice powder, soy sauce, and rice vinegar.
3. Roast duck in the oven for 1 hour, brushing with honey every 20 minutes.
4. Let duck rest before carving. Serve with pancakes or buns, cucumber, and scallions.

title: Shakshuka
summary: A North African dish of poached eggs in a spiced tomato and pepper sauce.
steps: 1. Heat olive oil in a pan and cook onions, garlic, and bell pepper until soft.
2. Stir in tomatoes and spices, simmering for 10 minutes.
3. Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them.
4. Cover and cook until eggs are done to your liking.
5. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with cilantro, and serve.

title: Lamb Rogan Josh
summary: An aromatic lamb curry from Kashmir, slow-cooked with a blend of spices.
steps: 1. Heat oil in a pot and cook lamb until browned.
2. Add onions, garlic, and ginger and sauté until soft.
3. Stir in spice mix and cook for 2 minutes.
4. Add tomatoes, yogurt, and beef broth. Simmer for 1 hour until lamb is tender.
5. Season with salt and pepper, and serve with rice or naan.

title: Falafel
summary: Middle Eastern deep-fried balls made from ground chickpeas and herbs.
steps: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight in water, then drain.
2. Blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, and baking powder in a food processor.
3. Form mixture into balls.
4. Heat oil in a pan and fry falafel until golden brown.
5. Drain on paper towels and serve with tahini sauce or pita bread.

title: Pho
summary: Vietnamese noodle soup with broth, rice noodles, herbs, and beef or chicken.
ingredients: Bean sprouts, lime wedges, and jalapeños for serving
steps: 1. In a large pot, simmer chicken or beef bones with onion, ginger, star anise, cinnamon, and cloves for 1-2 hours.
2. Strain the broth and return to pot. Season with fish sauce.
3. Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.
4. Divide noodles among bowls and ladle hot broth over them.
5. Garnish with fresh herbs, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and jalapeños.

title: Paella
summary: A Spanish rice dish with seafood, saffron, and vegetables.
steps: 1. Heat olive oil in a pan and cook onion and garlic until soft.
2. Stir in bell pepper, tomatoes, and rice, cooking for 2 minutes.
3. Add saffron and broth, and simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Add shrimp, mussels, and green peas. Cook until seafood is cooked through and rice is tender.
5. Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with lemon wedges.

title: Baklava
summary: A sweet Turkish pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and honey.
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Brush a baking dish with melted butter and layer with filo pastry, brushing each layer with butter.
3. Sprinkle chopped nuts between layers.
4. Bake for 45 minutes until golden and crisp.
5. Heat honey and sugar until dissolved, then pour over the hot baklava.
6. Let cool before cutting into pieces.

title: Gazpacho
summary: A cold Spanish tomato-based soup, served with diced vegetables.
steps: 1. Blend tomatoes until smooth.
2. Mix in cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and garlic.
3. Stir in olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
4. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
5. Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

title: Chicken Shawarma
summary: Marinated chicken roasted on a spit, served with pita bread and garlic sauce.
ingredients: Fresh vegetables (tomato, cucumber, lettuce) for serving
steps: 1. Marinate chicken in shawarma spice mix and olive oil for at least 1 hour.
2. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
3. Roast chicken in the oven for 25-30 minutes until fully cooked.
4. Slice chicken thinly and serve in pita breads with garlic sauce and fresh vegetables.

title: Clam Chowder
summary: A rich, creamy soup made with clams, potatoes, and onions.
steps: 1. In a pot, melt butter and cook onions and garlic until soft.
2. Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
3. Pour in chicken broth and simmer until potatoes are tender.
4. Add clams and cream, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

title: Jambalaya
summary: A spicy Louisiana dish made with rice, sausage, shrimp, and vegetables.
steps: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot and cook sausage until browned.
2. Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic, and cook until soft.
3. Stir in rice, tomatoes, chicken broth, paprika, and cayenne pepper.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
5. Add shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through.
6. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Coq au Vin
summary: A classic French dish of chicken braised with wine, mushrooms, and bacon.
steps: 1. In a large pot, cook bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside.
2. Brown chicken pieces in bacon fat and set aside.
3. In the same pot, cook onions and garlic until soft.
4. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Add wine, chicken broth, and thyme, and bring to a boil.
6. Return chicken and bacon to the pot, and add mushrooms.
7. Cover and simmer for 1 hour until chicken is tender.
8. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

title: Ramen
summary: A Japanese noodle soup with meat, eggs, and various toppings in a flavorful broth.
ingredients: 200g pork belly or chicken, thinly sliced
steps: 1. Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions and set aside.
2. In a pot, heat broth with garlic, soy sauce, and miso paste until simmering.
3. Add pork belly or chicken and cook until fully cooked.
4. In a separate pot, boil eggs for 6-7 minutes, then peel and set aside.
5. Add mushrooms and bean sprouts to the broth and cook until tender.
6. Divide noodles among bowls, ladle hot broth over them, and top with sliced meat, eggs, green onions, and nori.

title: Biryani
summary: An Indian dish made with spiced rice and meat, often chicken or lamb.
ingredients: 500g chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
steps: 1. Marinate meat in yogurt, biryani spice mix, salt, and pepper for at least 1 hour.
2. Heat oil in a pot and cook onions, garlic, and ginger until golden brown.
3. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
4. Add marinated meat and cook until browned.
5. Stir in rice and saffron, then add water.
6. Cover and cook on low heat until rice is tender and meat is cooked through.
7. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

title: Miso Soup
summary: A traditional Japanese soup with tofu, seaweed, and miso paste.
ingredients: 1 cup wakame seaweed, soaked and drained
steps: 1. Heat dashi or vegetable broth in a pot.
2. Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of warm broth and then stir into the pot.
3. Add tofu and wakame seaweed and cook until tofu is heated through.
4. Garnish with sliced green onions before serving.

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
summary: Bell peppers filled with rice, vegetables, and ground meat, baked until tender.
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Heat olive oil in a pan and cook onion and garlic until soft.
3. Add ground meat and cook until browned.
4. Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes, salt, pepper, and oregano.
5. Fill bell peppers with the mixture and place in a baking dish.
6. Top with shredded cheese and bake for 30 minutes until peppers are tender.
